text: Pours a cloudy straw color with white head. Light and well balanced and refreshing

On tap at Alewife in Baltimore. Pours a hazed gold with a medium sized white head. Soft musk, light honey and citrus. Medium bodied, sweet honey, bright citrus. Warm yeast, musk. Gentle and lovely. The lemon is a nice addition, and the chamomile makes an appearance lingering in the background.

Thanks Northopfrye! Pours a bright lemon colour with reddish sediment. Aromas of Belgian yeast, bright lemon, honey. A bit like a soothing tea. Similar flavours. Medicinal, bitter, a bit sour. Nice beer.
Bottle - Sweet, medicinal and herbal. Clearish gold with a decent white head. Perfumy, sweet, light medicinal notes and reminiscent of something of my childhood. A medicinal tonic syrup. Neat.

330mL bottle, pours a hazy pale golden blonde with a small white head. Aroma brings out fermented out honey, lemon zest and lemon juice. Flavour is a good mix of honey and lemon zest -- with not too much citric notes, nor sweetness. The two main elements go together really cohesively. Perfumey, floral finish. Pretty solid for what it is, just not overly my thing.

Bottle at MattsHazy light blond color, small head. Nice aroma, some flowers and vegetables; fresh smell. Dry mouthfeel; rather spicy flavor, with a mix of honey and wax; the bitterness in the final has some chicory trace.Ok beer, experimental, but thats all.

Light golden body with a medium white head. Aroma is spiced honey, maybe a hint of coriander. Flavor is very light and dry with slightly sweet honey in the finish. Its quite pleasant.

Wife: 4

Bright yellow body with haze and sediment, white fizzy head, not much lacing or retention. Warm yeasty, grainy aroma with a hint of honey. Taste is sweet, acidic, honey, yeast, kind of like a saison, a touch metallic. Very tingly lively palate. Not bad.

Slight hazy straw color with lots of bubbles and plenty of white fluffy head. Smells of sweet wheat, honey, lemon, spicy like coriander, funky perm in the background. Taste is a spicy hop, coriander, wheat, honey lemon, vanilla. Lot of carbonation, medium mouthfeel, good flavors that aren't overwhelming. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: &nbsp Bright straw, a touch of golden hue, fine sediment floating about, lively carbonation, large 

frothy white head, fairly nice lacing. &nbsp Spicy nose, seems like a Witbier. &nbsp Spicy and wheaty on the 

tongue. &nbsp Bright. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Flavorful from start to finish. &nbsp Nice wheaty 

body, with Witbier like spices that linger. &nbsp Enjoyable.

Slight hazy straw color with lots of bubbles and plenty of white fluffy head. Smells of sweet wheat, honey, lemon, spicy like coriander, funky perm in the background. Taste is a spicy hop, coriander, wheat, honey lemon, vanilla. Lot of carbonation, medium mouthfeel, good flavors that aren't overwhelming. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle. pours a pretty glowing yellow golden with white head. the aroma is very pleasant, lemon zest, coriander, pepper, floral bouquet, nice ester and phenol character, flavors continue in the same vein, excellent balance here, nice florals, citric, and peppery finish. carbonation is lively. mouth feel is a tad watery at times but thats really nitpicking. i dont think ive had a traditional belgian beer by an american brewer that has showed so much finesse in a long long time. a real beautiful stunner here.

Pours a slightly cloudy gold. Outstanding head volume and retention, world class lacing.

Nice nose of lemon, honey, notes of pepper, hints of spice (coriander) and a touch of funk.

Heavy light body with a semi-smooth texture. Perfectly carbonated with a nice effervescent burst in the middle and a rollicking finely bubbled prickly finish.

The outstanding flavor profile is a bit laid back, but very complex and perfectly balanced. The lemon and honey lead off, then the pepper and coriander assert themselves near the middle. A very subtle bitterness occurs in the middle that fades into a light saison funk over a balancing malt and honey sweetness. The finish is crisp. This may be the perfect beginner saison.
Really nice, spicy aroma. Lemon dominates. Pours yellow with a thick white head. Refreshing, but not particularly sessionable.
Draft. Poured golden with a thin white head and slight lacing. A floral aroma is followed by spiciness in the taste. There is a bit of sourness but overall it is well balanced.

12oz bottle. Pours orange with a fizzy white head. Lots of carbonation, and a fair amount of sediment. Aroma is of malt, hops, lemon, and grass. Taste is of lemon, malt, and grass. Has a fair amount of spice to it. Has an underlying sweet honey flavor. Lingering lemony taste. The lemon flavor in this is huge. Mouthfeel is light and very carbonated. Body is heavily carbonated and slightly sticky. Surprisingly drinkable and refreshing. Very good.
Another awesome brew from Off Color. Loving the honey on this one. Along with the spices and lemon zest, I would love some ceviche with this beer.

12 oz. bottle from Old Town. Aroma: Moderate honey; moderate coriander; light wildflowers; light lemon. Appearance: Slightly hazy yellow body with lively carbonation holding up a solid white head that settles into a solid cap. Flavor: Honey lemon lozenge up front with a bit more coriander and other spices towards the finish, which is pretty dry. Palate: Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: Quite liked this; others have compared it to a Tripel, and its an apt comparison.
Lots of honey band good florals here. Golden pour with good head and lacing. Light sweet, with a good balance overall. I like this one. Easy drinking and tasty.
Draft. hazy to cloudy yellow straw color, medium white head. Aroma of citrus, coriander. Taste has mixed herbs and spiced lemon, subtle banana. Interesting.
Notes of honey, fresh cracked pepper, and floral notes. Highly carbonated, but not in an annoying way. Very flavorful for a light beer and the subtleties are kinda nice.
bottle #4 at poker before switching to whiskey. hazed golden pour nose of citrus and spice. tastes of coriander, peppery, honey, lemons, hay, florals, slight herbal. some malt on finish. nice brew

12oz bottle from the bar at Giant Eagle in Grandview: yellow pour, slight white ring of retention. aroma of coriander, spice, fruit. tastes are musty, candied lemon candied. yeasty, floral, coriander herbal. light tingle in medium palate. 7.2

I am not sure what a bier de miel even is but this is something along the lines of a Belgain blond, pushing into triple territory. Its cloudy yelow w/ a thin white head of medium bubbles. Its nose is bread yeast up front which develops into more of a spicy character. This beer seems a little sweet at first but that sweetness is softened by some citrus character and--more so than that--vigorous but gentle carbonation, which also gives it a nice, full mouthfeel. It finishes rather light w/o being sticky or cloying at all and is overall a nice beer, though I do find myself wishing the had the same combination of flavors in a lower alcohol beer.

Crisp hazy golden coloured body with a thick, four centimetre tall white head. Aroma of hay, grass, honey, yeast and a bit of alcohol - very nice and pungent. Medium-bodied; Assertive effervescence with rose petals, lavender, coriander seed, curacao, flowers, apples, honey, hay, grass and a good deal of wheat - very nice and super complex, especially for the style. Aftertaste is rich and well-rounded with the grassy and hay flavours at first making the spices and complex character that much more full. Overall, a very well-crafted beer with a lot of nuances and a great profile throughout - very nice to try! I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased just a few minutes ago at Whole Foods (Bowery) in New York, New York on 18-June-2015 for US$3,99 sampled in my hotel room here on Bowery in New York on 18-June-2015.

Bottle in the old dining room!
Pours a lightly hazy pale yellow with a decent head and some lacing on the glass.

The aroma has a nice citrus zest thing going on as well as some nice spice and mineral notes. 
The flavor is mildly tart, a little punchy, florally bitter, with some citrus character and plenty of spiciness. The bitterness is sort of bracing towards the finish & it gives a nice lingering sensation. 

The beer is more spice driven than I would usually prefer, but its really in good form here, lots of stuff I dont normally get excited about in beers sort of working together to make a decent whole... fun

12 oz single bottle from Mollys Spirits. Golden orange and hazy appearance with a white head and active carbonation. Aroma of honey, lemon zest, herbs, sweet malts and light spices. Similar flavor, mildly sweet and light zesty bitterness with a mild tart finish. Everything comes together nicely. Medium body with a soft, creamy feel. Pretty nice overall.
on tap at Moor Pat, Wiliamsville, NY. golden pour, fuller mouthfeel. Lemon, herbal, bubblegum, fruity yeast, hints of honey. Great flavor, very saisony. Very Good
Aroma is spices and worcestershire sauce/ketchup. The flavor is pale malts, very light lemons and a mildly spicy finish.

Bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have pale malts, some honey sweetness, wildflowers, floral, mild lemony citrus, lemon zest, refreshing, interesting beer.

Bottle. Poured clear dark golden color with an average frothy off-white head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy malt and herbal and citrus aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy complex sweet and herbal flavor with medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Solid complex beer.

11.2oz bottle, thanks to tmoney99 for sharing. Hazy golden color. Nice slightly off-white head, with decent thicker lace. Very nice floral, and wildflower honey aroma in the nose. Lightly peppery. Lemon is a nice, restrained addition. Works well. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, kind of soft, lighter carbonation. Light dry finish. Pretty impressively smooth, impressively refreshing for a 7.5% ale featuring honey. Moderate sweet taste, nice zest, mild bitter, and a dry finish.
On draft at Lord Hobo in Cambridge. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a white head. Light tropical fruit nose. Flavors of lemon and spices. Smooth finish.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with three fingers of white foam. Nose is lemon zest, sourdough bread, grass, toasted malt and some musty forest floor complexity. Palate is solid and focused but not quite as complex and interesting as the nose lead me to believe it was going to be. Solid offering.
Pours very pale an clear with lots of tiny bubbles. Aroma is spicy. Mouth feel is light with a lot of carbonation. Flavor is reminiscent of a Saison with nice spice and a touch of lemon. Very good.
Bottle. Hazy yellow pour with a white ring head. Cool aroma of chamomile, coriander, fruity, spicy. Lively palate. Very good.
Light malty honey nose. Cloudy bright color with no head. Slight apparent honeyed sweetness with clean slight citrus dry finish! Another great interpretation from this awesome brewery.

Bottle - hazy pale gold - nose of cardamom, white pepper, honey, wildflower, lemon, grass, light muskiness - nice frothiness in he mouth - flavor is dry up front, moderately spicy/peppery - honey sweetness later, but some countering dry mineral character - white pepper, lemon peel, grass, ginger - very tasty beer.

Draft at Eulogy. Hazy yellow gold pour with a large amount of eggy meringue white foam. Nice lace. Fuller bodied than expected. Grassy. Bit herbal. Lemon verbena. Juniper berries. Honeycomb. Dandelions. Chamomile. Juicy fuzzy bitter lemon. Touch sour. Well made.

12oz bottle in a tulip. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of light spices, some pale malts, light citrus notes, hints of honey, and some light clove notes. Flavor the same with a decent blend. Average texture. Sort of a boring beer.

bottle. Pours a bright, deep, yellow straw with medium carbonation, a small white head, and some sticky lacing. Nose is lemon, herbal, coriander, honey, some biscuity malts. Medium bodied with flavors of honey, lemon, light Belgian esters, coriander, other herbal/flowery notes. Finishes with some herbal notes, light citrus and bananabut pretty dry overall. Better than I expected. A nice summer quaffer.

Bottle. Pours a pale, hazy yellow-gold, medium white head with decent enough retention and lacking. Nose is funky yeast, earthy, spices, lemon peel. Mouth is medium bodied, creamy, lightly sweet, melange of spice, clover honey, grass, wildflowers, light mintiness, chamomile, built on a bready chassis. Very nice. ABV is so under the radar, this could get ya in trouble. Memorial Day weekend I always reflect upon the people who died to keep us free -- and I spent more than just a little of my time as a soldier walking amongst the rows of stones in Arlington National Cemetery, ruminating on what it all meant then and still means today. Politics and all that go out the window today. All that matters is what they sacrificed. The only thing I can say to those men and women who served the posterity of our nation is thank you and God Bless. Cheers.
Nose is musky, earthy, juniper, floral. Flavor is more floral, herbaceous, medicinal, nectar, spicy/grassy hops.

Bottled. 5cl sample. Thanks Menno for sharing. The aroma has citrus, juniper/spice. Pale yellow coloured beer with a thin, white head. The taste is light-moderate bitter. Refreshing taste, sparkling mouthfeel. Okay.
Bottle shared by Menno, thanks! Quite some honey and herbs in the aroma. Flavor is slightly bitter and spicy. Nice balance.

Bottle in snifter: Poured carefully to leave the sediment in the bottle so I got a crystal clear pale golden hue with a fading fizzy head and not much lace. Plenty of flowery, spicy and honey esters on the nose. Light hop presence but it help develop complexity. The taste is part honey and part lemon zest with additional touches of Chamomile, Coriander and Rose Hips. The Juniper jumps in as in warmed which is a welcomed event. Smart carbonation with a mouth watering twangy finish. No way I would think this 7.5% ABV, drinks so much easier than that. This would have been a great Spring beer but alas that is not the case. I still dig it as a opening salvo on this blistery day.

355ml bottle. HAzed super-lght pour. The aroma is nice: juniper, lemon, herbs, bit of typical off color yeast hcaracter. Like a floral gin. Flavor is spicy and herbal, it is dry, with jsut a bti of maltiness. Really pleasant beer, could drink it all day.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a pale hazy golden color with a small white head, nice lacing. Aroma of lemon, spice, and honey. Flavor of honey, spice, mild tartness from the lemon. Medium bodied, with lively carbonation and cooling at the back of the throat, almost like cough drop. Pretty interesting.
